markdownRemark.html:
Introduction

Rich Hicky gave an insightful talk on the role of type systems. In it he presents incisive commentary on the use of exhaustive typing enforced by languages like Haskell. Strict typing in programming languages reveals, as he outlines for us, that at a high-level programming is the process of automating tasks and procedures that exist in an evolving domain.

Programs excel at automating repetitive tasks. With the advent of more advanced techniques such as Machine Learning we see computers automating fuzzy, high-level tasks. On the spectrum from simple to sophisticated we may have “add these two numbers together” vs “recognise this person in this crowd of faces”. The thing both of these tasks have in common is that they exist within a specific problem space.

An article by John De Goes
